subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Ghost Box Demo at Moundsville WV
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_0050_01C9DEE2.8A16E060
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Oh don't EVEN get me started on the homeless thing...

Those "poor ghosts" =
in that prison were murderers, rapist, etc. They put themselves there. They=
 have the capacity to free themselves if they would realize it. In fact the=
y would probably learn something by doing it themselves, as opposed to gett=
ing it handed to them without working for it.

I wish them neither harm nor=
 foul, but I will not go out of my way to help any such soul.



  ----- Or=
iginal Message ----- 
  From: SnowfireL@... 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.=
com 
  Sent: Wednesday, May 27, 2009 2:05 PM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Ghost=
 Box Demo at Moundsville WV






  Isn't this kind of like a poor person o=
n the street, living in a cardboard box, or in poverty, sure they put thems=
elves there, many disowned by family, lost of jobs, no education, lack of m=
otivation when they were children, a drunken family that was nothing but se=
lfish, didn't care about their own children, nor the future of the children=
.  These are ignored by strangers, and the community, look away, no one see=
s them so, they are don't exist.  Bums the lot of them!  Is this how it's t=
o be forever?  Poor ghosts of society, they should be helped in any way we =
can, prayer is like sending positive wishes, thoughts are things, negatives=
 bring more negatives, positive thoughts do help others.   And so nothing c=
hanges, nothing improves...

  In a message dated 5/27/2009 3:49:16 P.M. Ea=
stern Daylight Time, april@... writes:




    I s=
ay they put themselves in there, they can get themselves out.

      ----- =
Original Message ----- 
      From: Steve Hill 
      To: EVP-ITC@yahoogrou=
ps.com 
      Sent: Wednesday, May 27, 2009 1:40 PM
      Subject: Re: [EVP=
-ITC] Ghost Box Demo at Moundsville WV



      Yes, you need speical permi=
ssion. I was there for an all night ghost hunt as a guest of Eastern Parano=
rmal. The place can be rented at night but believe me when i say "it ain't =
cheap". Plus I don't think the prison would appreciate me releaseing the in=
mates before their eternal sentence has been served.
      Steve




------=
--------------------------------------------------------------------
      =
From: "SnowfireL@..." <SnowfireL@...>
      To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups=
.com
      Sent: Wednesday, May 27, 2009 2:31:57 PM
      Subject: Re: [EVP=
-ITC] Ghost Box Demo at Moundsville WV



      Does one need special permi=
ssion to get in there?  You folks should go back, and release them since a =
few of them already know you Steve, this is Steve?  Right?  sf

      In a =
message dated 5/27/2009 2:15:10 P.M. Eastern Daylight Time, foreverhaunted5=
7@ yahoo.com writes:




        Unfortunately I did not get to attempt to =
cross them. After my demonstration, another group that was also there start=
ed complaining that the box made too much noise and was hendering their inv=
estigation so I turned it off. I wouldn't want my direct communication with=
 the deceased inmates to mess up their EVP work, now would I? I apoligized =
and put it away for the rest of the night.
         According to the prison=
 staff, the inmates firmly believed that if they died in prison their souls=
 would be forever trapped there. This belief was so strong that the prison =
officials would take the elderly inmates who were dying of natural causes t=
o a local hospital so they would'nt have to die in the prison. Maybe their =
beliefs were well founded.     




---------------------------------------=
---------------------------------
        From: "SnowfireL@aol. com" <Snowf=
ireL@aol. com>
        To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
        Sent: Wednesday=
, May 27, 2009 12:36:12 PM
        Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Ghost Box Demo at=
 Moundsville WV



        This is a wonderful recording, were you able to =
free any of them?  So sad to see them still there behind bars, must be very=
 lonely for them, they should be moving on so, they can start to work on ma=
king up for things on the other side.  You folks should go up there again, =
and hold a small prayer vigil for them, of course they would no longer be g=
hosts trapped there, but there are plenty more around. sf

        In a mes=
sage dated 5/27/2009 12:10:56 P.M. Eastern Daylight Time, foreverhaunted57@=
 yahoo.com writes:



          I was invited to spend the night in the Wes=
t Virginia Penitentiary this past weekend.. I was asked to give a short dem=
onstration with my Optimus 12-797 hacked radio. Deep inside the prison surr=
ounded by concrete and steel, the radio could not pick up any radio station=
s in manual mode. I wasn't sure how this might effect the demonstration. I =
was pleasantly suprised with the results. I recorded the session and the re=
sults can be heard at this link. http://www.youtube. com/watch? v=3DKwDYu4R=
ULlk
